issue.title: www.techmaniak.pl

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://www.techmaniak.pl](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.techmaniak.pl) ### Comment > Puste pola po reklamach na wszystkich domenach techmaniak. Zgłaszałem jakiś rok temu, ale znowu od długiego czasu ktoś zgubił tę kosmetyczną regułę, czyli ciągle nie możecie ogarnąć bałaganu w listach filtrów dla wszystkich przeglądarek na Chromium. Derick ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/qodf627q15w4cg4ksckcckcokc040kl7zcbzfr4j4o.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Android v4.10 Nightly 2 System version: | Android 9 Browser: | Cromite - open source instalowana z repozytorium na github.com License type: | paid AdGuard mode: | VPN HTTPS filtering: | enabled Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Block trackers,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header

**Tracking methods**:
Self-destructing third-party cookies (180),
Self-destructing first-party cookies (4320),
Disable cache for third-party requests,
Block third-party Authorization header

**Browser API**:
Block WebRTC,
Block Push API,
Block Location API

**Miscellaneous**:
Hide your Referrer from third-parties,
Hide your User-Agent (google chrome),
Hide your IP address (101.54.122.225),
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
Protect against DPI DNS filtering: | server: `quic://dns.adguard-dns.com`

comment.body:
Nie potrafię odtworzyć tego problemu.
Może w przeglądarce `Cromite` nie działa filtrowanie `HTTPS` albo problem powoduje jedna z list trzecich.

labels.name: A: In progress

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/207123#issuecomment-2966179432
>The website track adguard and when I try to remove manually the popup it detect that was removed and re-appear

It has been fixed 2 days ago, but the problem is that MV3 extension cannot update filters, due to Google policy. So new rules will be available in one of the next extension updates.

Until then, please add following rules to user rules:
```adblock
smartworld.it#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'adsbygoogle', 'emptyObj')
smartworld.it#%#//scriptlet('abort-on-stack-trace', 'Node.prototype.appendChild', '/js/min/common.min.js')
smartworld.it#%#//scriptlet('prevent-xhr', '/pagead2\.googlesyndication\.com|adsafeprotected\.com|adsense\/search\/ads\.js|cdn\.iubenda\.com\/cs\/iubenda_cs\.js/')
smartworld.it#%#//scriptlet('prevent-fetch', '/pagead2\.googlesyndication\.com|adsafeprotected\.com|adsense\/search\/ads\.js|cdn\.iubenda\.com\/cs\/iubenda_cs\.js/')
smartworld.it#%#//scriptlet('prevent-element-src-loading', 'script', '/pagead2\.googlesyndication\.com|adsafeprotected\.com|adsense\/search\/ads\.js|cdn\.iubenda\.com\/cs\/iubenda_cs\.js/')
smartworld.it#$#body > script[src*="/common.min.js"] ~ :is(div,span)[class]:not([class*=" "]):not([style*="position"]):not(:empty):has(span > img[src*="/favicons?domain=www.smartworld.it/"][style]) { display: none !important; }
```
